page.title: 12Local Transport
page.content: Bransgore is a rural village and therefore has a limited public transport service. There are two main services. The{bus}from Burley to Christchurch passes through the village everday at hourly intervals and stops running at 9.57pm. A{bus also travels through the village on route from Christchurch to Ringwood.This bus is about ever hour and finishes quite early in the evening.Bus shelters have recently been provided at the main bus stops. {Trains}can be caught at the Christchurch station and also Hinton Admiral Station.These stations are about three miles away. Both are on the main line to London. There is also a local{Taxi}service and most local residents use their own cars or bicycles.
